txt.en:
'It looks as though you have strayed a little ways from home, [placeholder], and you want to learn about prospecting?

'Seems, then, that you have come to the right place.

'You want to speak with Bin√≠r the supplier here. He will be able to set you upon the path of prospecting.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Prospecting, is it? A fine choice for any self-respecting dwarf!

'Ore and the refinement thereof is almost as important in dwarf-culture as the pillars that are carved out of the mountain in our greatest halls. Fine folk, prospectors.

'Talk with the supplier here. He will set you on the path to becoming another in a long litany of fine prospectors.'

'You are far from home, [placeholder]. We will honour your request and help you as you learn the art of prospecting.

'Aglallen, the supplier here, will instruct you in the art of prospecting.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>

'Metals are necessary in the crafting of armour, jewellery, and weaponry; without them, many of the masterworks of the Elves would have never come to be. I am pleased to see that there are still Elves who would search through the pockets of ore for the finest metals that they can refine.\n\n'Aglallen, the supplier here, is willing to instruct you further with your study of prospecting.'

'You will find Marigold Grubb here in the Crafting Area.

'She is a supplier and has offered to instruct those looking to set out in this profession.

'Speak with her if you are interested in learning and practicing the prospecting profession.'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have made a copper ingot

'Collecting ore and refining it into ingots for metalworking professions is a necessity. Without any folk who do this, how would metalsmiths, weaponsmiths, or jewellers be able to make their wares?\n\n'You will want to speak with Marigold Grubb, the supplier here. She has volunteered her time and energy to teach all the new apprentices. Mind her well.'
You have made a tin ingot

'Well, look at you. I do not often see your folk here, and when I do, I always find it a bit queer. Well, hobbits less so because of the hill.

'Oh, I am sorry, you wish to know more of prospecting? Todd Brushwood, the supplier here, has offered to teach all who wish to know the finer points of prospecting.

'Good day, [placeholder].'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: You must make sure to have room in your inventory for this quest.</rgb>
You have activated your <rgb=#FF00FF00>Track Ore</rgb> skill!

'Prospecting is the collection and refinement of metals from the raw ore found throughout the world. Ore-nodes also can hide gemstones and other objects that can be shared with other professions.\n\n'Todd Brushwood, the supplier here, has offered to teach all those who are looking to set out as prospectors.'

'If you are looking for guidance in prospecting, then I am prepared to offer you direction.

'I will do my best to provide you with clear direction. The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I have kept some of these ingredients aside for purpose of providing to new prospectors. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Suppliers provide the secondary ingredients necessary for prospectors to refine the materials that they collect. As this is a collection profession, there are no additional recipes to purchase as all are learned as you advance.</rgb>

Prospectors mine ore-nodes to discover the raw materials hidden within. They are also adept at working the ore into ingots. Ore-nodes not only provide ore, but will often contain gems or other objects that are used by other professions. This collection profession is much-needed in Middle-earth.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Be careful! You will need to complete the correct recipe and deliver the correct item outlined in this quest.

You will need to execute the smelt copper recipe and deliver a copper ingot. Failing to do so will force you to obtain new raw materials or to restart the quest after a 24-hour delay.</rgb>
Speak with the supplier in the crafting area
You have been provided with ingredients
Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> given to you by the supplier to collect the two chunks of copper ore
You now have all the ingredients to make a copper ingot
Using the ingredients you received, craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>
Using the ingredients you received craft a <rgb=#FF00FF00>tin ingot</rgb>
Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb> to the supplier
#-1:[placeholder]Bring the <rgb=#FF00FF00>Copper and Tin Ingots</rgb> to #-1:{Marigold[O]|Aglallen[L]|TBD[D]|Todd}
'Have you lost the ingot? Did you sell it? Did you make it? You need to find a new ingot if you want me to recognize your work.'
You should speak with the supplier to learn more about prospecting.

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for prospectors are found in ore-nodes in the wild, sometimes in chests, and purchased from suppliers. You can also find ingredients in the Auction Hall.</rgb>\n\nThe supplier provided you with a <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> full of ingredients that you can use to execute the prospector recipe. Open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> to get the ingredients.
The Supplier provided you with the ingredients necessary to create a <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>.
The recipe is complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the copper ingot!</rgb> It is time to show your handiwork to your mentor, the supplier.

#-1:[placeholder]The recipes are complete. <rgb=#FF00FF00>Do not sell the Copper or Tin Ingots!</rgb> Time to show your handiwork to your mentor #-1:{Marigold[O]|Aglallen[L]|TBD[D]|Todd}. Show them how well you did in executing your first prospector recipes.

'Hello, there. I hear that you are interested in learning the ways of a prospector. If so, you have come to the right place.

'I almost forgot the most important thing for every new prospector -- ingredients. Everything you need is inside this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Suppliers provide the secondary ingredients necessary for Prospectors to refine the materials that they collect. As this is a collection profession there are no additional recipes to purchase as all are learned as you advance.</rgb>
'You should speak with the supplier at once.'

'Well, look here... another would-be prospector. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new prospectors like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Suppliers provide the secondary ingredients necessary for prospectors to refine the materials that they collect. As this is a collection profession, there are no additional recipes to purchase as all recipes are automatically learned as you advance.</rgb>
'You should speak with the supplier at once.'

'Well, look here... another would-be prospector. I am pleased to meet you and looking forward to helping you get started.

'The first and most important step is having the proper ingredients.

'I set aside a few for new prospectors like yourself. Take this <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> and let us begin.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>Suppliers provide the secondary ingredients necessary for Prospectors to refine the materials that they collect. As this is a collection profession there are no additional recipes to purchase as all are learned as you advance.</rgb>
'You should speak with the supplier at once.'

'Let me see what you were able to do....'

She inspects the copper ingot.

'It appears that there are no impurities in this ingot. 

'I think that you have done very, very well, [placeholder]. I approve and declare you novice prospector.'
'You should speak with the supplier at once.'
'Oh no, did you sell your copper ingot? Well, I need to inspect it, so you had better find a way to make me more.'

'Good work, so far. Get your hands back to work and refine that <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Prospecting tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe you must be near the proper facility. Prospecting requires a forge.</rgb>

'Let me see what you have done.'

He examines the items closely.

'The copper ingot appears to have been refined without a hint of impurity.

'I think that this is a very good effort and proves that you are prepared to continue your work towards becoming a master prospector.'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>prospector's pickaxe</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for prospectors are found in chests, gathered from ore-nodes, and purchased from suppliers. You can also find ingredients in the Auction Hall.</rgb>
'Do you have the item I requested on you? I do not see it. I hope you did not sell it for coin. I would like to inspect that work. Best find a way to make another.'

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>prospector's pickaxe</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for prospectors are found in chests, gathered from ore-nodes, and purchased from suppliers. You can also find ingredients in the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>prospector's pickaxe</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for prospectors are found in chests, gathered from ore-nodes, and purchased from suppliers. You can also find ingredients in the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'May I see the item that I requested you to make for me?'

He takes a moment to admire your handiwork.

'This is a fine example of purified ore... nary a fault in the refinement process can be seen. You are well on your way towards becoming a prospector. Well done, [placeholder].'

'Good work, so far. Get your hands back to work and refine that <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Prospecting tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe you must be near the proper facility. Prospecting requires a forge.</rgb>

'Good work, so far. Get your hands back to work and refine that <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Prospecting tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe you must be near the proper facility. Prospecting requires a forge.</rgb>
'Have you forgotten something? I do not see the item that you were supposed to deliver to me. You should return with it.'
Introduction to Prospecting

'Good work, so far. Get your hands back to work and refine that <rgb=#FF00FF00>copper ingot</rgb>.'

<rgb=#FF00FF00>To open your crafting panel, you can use the T key or click on the crafting button (it looks like a hammer and anvil) in the lower left part of your UI.

Select the Prospecting tab in the craft UI and find the proper recipe.

Remember: in order to execute a recipe you must be near the proper facility. Prospecting requires a forge.</rgb>

'Grab your <rgb=#FF00FF00>prospector's pickaxe</rgb> and make sure you have it equipped, then open the <rgb=#FF00FF00>crate</rgb> of ingredients that I gave you and make your way to the forge.'\n\n<rgb=#FF00FF00>Ingredients for prospectors are found in chests, gathered from ore-nodes, and purchased from suppliers. You can also find ingredients in the Auction Hall.</rgb>

'Well now, let us see what you have here.'

He examines the item.

'It looks as though you have smelted that ingot very well. I think that you are well on your way to becoming a true prospector.'
